chunks.en: ğŸ‰My little padded jacket (daughter) is born, reproductive isolation has been broken.
ğŸ˜‚ My dating experience post isn't finished yet, and now I have to devote myself wholeheartedly to the parenting business.
After my wife finished her postdoc, she has been working in a university in Shanghai and was promoted to associate professor a few years ago. I graduated from junior college 13 years ago.
However, because my wife's physical condition is not good, it is difficult for her to get pregnant.
We did IVF for 3 years. My wife had many injections, took a lot of medicine, and had several hysteroscopies and even open myomectomy.
After three years of IVF without success, we were discouraged and about to give up.
Last year, she conceived naturally!ğŸ¤¯

The pregnancy was not smooth sailing. Because of the poor uterine cavity condition, there were multiple biochemical pregnancies during previous IVF attempts, so the doctor arranged for full-course immune and pregnancy-preserving drugs during the insurance period.

However, at 29 and 31 weeks, she was hospitalized twice for threatened abortion due to placenta previa and massive bleeding. In the last two months of pregnancy, we both stared at the fetal heart monitor every day, and we were both exhausted.

The baby is very competitive. From the first time we saw her shadow on the test strip (two bars), all the indicators in the entire early pregnancy were at the upper limit of the textbook. Sure enough, the development potential of natural selection is the strongest.
The attending doctor we booked is a famous chief physician in Shanghai who deals with high-risk pregnant women.
On the day of the cesarean section, the doctor opened the uterine cavity and said that it was a miracle that this child could survive in this uterine cavity environment.

![Daughter's photo]( https://i.imgur.com/kA1G1JB.jpeg)

Reproductive isolation is really hard to break.
Congratulations, but a reminder to the poster, reproductive isolation is not used in this way.
Congratulations, but reproductive isolation cannot be used in this way. I thought you had done something with other non-human species?
Reproductive isolation refers to the self-deprecating junior college students and doctoral students == Why doesn't everyone have a sense of humor?

chunks.en: My wife has been working in a university in Shanghai since she finished her postdoctoral studies, and was promoted to associate professor a few years ago. I graduated from junior college 13 years ago. University: University of East London - BSc Computer Science. You call this... a junior college?
What junior college people say is really ridiculous, congratulations.
@None123 #9 The poster should be mocking himself for being a junior college graduate and his wife being a postdoc.
It is recommended to change the title, you will be unhappy if you get flamed later.
Congratulations OP. From the chaotic title, I can feel OP's joy. Whether it's used correctly or not is a trivial matter. Mother and daughter are safe is the best.
